shellshocker

Class TheGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • shellshocker.TheGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TheGame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Creates an interactive menu system that users will be able to navigate around. The game menu has logins that allow returning users to access their personal accounts. Users who wish to start new profiles may generate accounts using the menu. Interactive tutorials and credits accompany the other features of the menu.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TheGame()
      Default constructor for class TheGame. Creates a JFrame which will contain the game. The method also calls out to methods that start the game by starting a menu and take in all images used in the game menu.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createProfiles()
      Creates profiles from a stored file.
      static void createScoreBoard()
      Creates a score board list from a saved file that is later presented to the user at the end of the game.
      static void deathScreen()
      Creates a screen with button options when the user-controlled character dies.
      static void displayScores()
      Creates a score board screen with options that is presented to the user at the end of the game.
      static void endGame(int score)
      Creates a screen with options that is presented to the user at the end of the game.
      static void fatalError()
      Discards the game, called when fatal error occurs that stops the game from working properly.
      void getSlides()
      Gets images used in the menu. Adds the images to appropriate locations
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method of the ShellShocker package. Calls the default constructor of the the class TheGame.
      static void pauseScreen()
      Creates a screen with button options for the user when the game is paused.
      static void removeProfile()
      Removes the current profile accessed by the user from the list of profiles.
      void runCredits()
      Runs a screen containing the credits for the game.
      void runLoginPage()
      Runs a page containing a login system in which a user enters a username and password in order to access a profile.
      void runNewUser()
      Runs a page that allows users to create new profiles. A username and password are asked to be entered by the user.
      void runStartPage()
      Runs the start page of the menu. The start page will include buttons that provide options to the user for accessing the game along with other information about the game.
      void runTutorial()
      Runs a navigable tutorial screen system intended to teach the game user the basic information about the ShellShocker game.
      static void saveGame()
      Saves the game into a stored file.
      static void sortScores()
      Sorts high scores into descending order to be presented on a scoreboard.
      static void startGame(Profile p)
      Starts the game by removing the menu from the JFrame and adding the game.

      • startGame

        public static void startGame(Profile p)
        Starts the game by removing the menu from the JFrame and adding the game.
        Parameters:
        p - the current profile used to start the game.

      • runStartPage

        public void runStartPage()
        Runs the start page of the menu. The start page will include buttons that provide options to the user for accessing the game along with other information about the game.

      • runTutorial

        public void runTutorial()
        Runs a navigable tutorial screen system intended to teach the game user the basic information about the ShellShocker game.

      • runCredits

        public void runCredits()
        Runs a screen containing the credits for the game.

      • runLoginPage

        public void runLoginPage()
        Runs a page containing a login system in which a user enters a username and password in order to access a profile.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - Login text file not found
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - - Login text file information formatting does not match format required

      • runNewUser

        public void runNewUser()
        Runs a page that allows users to create new profiles. A username and password are asked to be entered by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Login file could not be written into.
